perturbation.original_text: (i) the Board will unanimously recommend that the stockholders of the Company vote to elect each member of the 2020 Director Slate as a director of the Company at the 2020 Annual Meeting, (ii) the Company will use its reasonable best efforts (which will include the solicitation of proxies) to obtain the election of the 2020 Director Slate at the 2020 Annual Meeting and (iii) the Company will use its best efforts to resist, discourage and defend against any attempt, solicitation or action by any stockholder of the Company to remove any member of the 2020 Director Slate prior to the 2021 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: (i) the Board will unanimously recommend that the stockholders of the Company vote to elect each member of the 2020 Director Slate as a director of the Company at the 2020 Annual Meeting, (ii) the Company may, at its sole discretion, solicit proxies to obtain the election of the 2020 Director Slate at the 2020 Annual Meeting and (iii) the Company has no obligation to resist, discourage, or defend against any attempt, solicitation, or action by any stockholder of the Company to remove any member of the 2020 Director Slate prior to the 2021 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause commits the Company to using its best efforts to solicit proxies and defend against attempts to remove directors. The modified clause removes this commitment and gives the company discretion, thus potentially undermining the board's fiduciary duty to act in the best interest of the shareholders.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Fiduciary Duty, Delaware General Corporation Law Section 141

perturbation.original_text: Within five (5) business days following receipt of reasonably satisfactory documentation thereof, the Company will reimburse the MG Capital Parties for their fees and expenses (including all legal, public relations, proxy advisory and out-of-pocket expenses, the "Expenses") incurred in preparation for and in connection with the matters relating to the consent solicitation run by the MG Capital Parties, the 2020 Annual Meeting and the negotiation, execution and effectuation of this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby, in an amount equal to $352,290.25 (the "Initial Reimbursement"). Between the date of the Initial Reimbursement and the date of the 2020 Annual Meeting, the Company will reimburse the MG Capital Parties for the Expenses in an aggregate amount not exceeding $650,000 (inclusive of the Initial Reimbursement, the "Cap"), which Expenses shall be reimbursed on a dollar-for-dollar basis at the same time as the Company reimburses its third party vendors (e.g., legal counsel, public relations firm, financial advisor and proxy advisory firm)in connection with the MG Capital Parties' consent solicitation and Nomination Notice; provided that all Expenses, subject to the Cap, shall be reimbursed no later than the date of the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company will reimburse the MG Capital Parties for their fees and expenses at its sole discretion, with no obligation to provide any reimbursement within a specific timeframe. The amount and timing of any reimbursement will be determined solely by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change makes the reimbursement of expenses entirely discretionary on the part of the Company, removing any obligation for timely reimbursement and potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, Violation of Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement will terminate upon the earlier of: (i) the conclusion of the Standstill Period or (ii) delivery of written notice by one Party to the other Party of a material breach of this Agreement by the breaching Party that is uncured after ten (10) calendar days of notice of such breach.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement will terminate immediately upon the Company's discretion, without notice to the MG Capital Parties, and may be enacted if the Company determines that such termination is in its best interest, regardless of any breach or event.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires a material breach and a 10-day notice period for termination. The modified clause allows for termination at the Company's sole discretion, without notice or cause, potentially violating principles of good faith, fair dealing, and fiduciary duty, and undermining the MG Capital Parties' rights under the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract, Violation of Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Potential Breach of Fiduciary Duty
